    • register

      @PostMapping("/register") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<com.synoradzki.paymoverecruitment.security.auth.AuthenticationResponse> register(@Valid @RequestBody @Valid com.synoradzki.paymoverecruitment.security.auth.RegisterRequest request) throws com.synoradzki.paymoverecruitment.exception.AlreadyExistsException
      The method registers new users POST /api/v1/auth/register
      Parameters:
      request - RegisterRequest(String firstname, String lastname, String email, String password, Role) all fields must be delivered, email is validated. Role options Role.ADMIN, Role.USER
      Returns:
      JWT token if successful, otherwise returns 403 status code.
      Throws:
      com.synoradzki.paymoverecruitment.exception.AlreadyExistsException - Status code 403 error message: "email already exists in database"

    • authenticate

      @PostMapping("/authenticate") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<com.synoradzki.paymoverecruitment.security.auth.AuthenticationResponse> authenticate(@RequestBody com.synoradzki.paymoverecruitment.security.auth.AuthenticationRequest request)
      The method authenticates users POST /api/v1/auth/authenticate
      Parameters:
      request - AuthenticationRequest(String email, String password)
      Returns:
      JWT token if successful, otherwise returns 403 status code.
